page.title: 02Staindrop continued
page.content: housing for the villagers. Staindrop is one of County Durham's green villages which has developed westward from the church. There are attractive stone built houses surrounding the green, while modern development has taken place to the west and south-east of the village. The rest of the survey area is largely taken up with farmland and wooded areas. Included are several farms which are fairly typical of farms in this area. There is no manufacturing industry in the village and employment is largely in service or 'one man' industries with the exeption of the local schools and the 'Raby Estate'.
